name: PicoLimbo
author: quozul@pm.me
description: A lightweight Minecraft server written from scratch in Rust supporting Minecraft versions from 1.7.2 up to the most recent ones.

installation.script:
#!/bin/sh
# PicoLimbo Installation Script
set -e

apk add --no-cache curl jq

# 1) detect arch
UNAME_M="$(uname -m)"
case "$UNAME_M" in
  x86_64)   ARCH='x86_64' ;;
  aarch64)  ARCH='aarch64' ;;
  *)
    echo "ERROR: Unsupported arch: $UNAME_M" >&2
    exit 1
    ;;
esac

GITHUB_PACKAGE="Quozul/PicoLimbo"
PATTERN="pico_limbo_linux-${ARCH}-musl[.]tar[.]gz"

select_asset_url() {
  # expects .assets[] in stdin, returns one URL matching $PATTERN
  jq -r --arg pat "$PATTERN" '
    .assets[].browser_download_url
    | select(test($pat))
  '
}

# 2) fetch all releases once
echo "Fetching GitHub releases metadata..."
ALL_JSON="$(curl -s "https://api.github.com/repos/$GITHUB_PACKAGE/releases")"
LATEST_JSON="$(printf '%s\n' "$ALL_JSON" \
  | jq 'map(select(.prerelease==false)) | sort_by(.published_at) | reverse | .[0]')"

# 3) decide URL
if [ -n "$DOWNLOAD_URL" ]; then
  echo "Using provided DOWNLOAD_URL"
  if ! curl -Isf "$DOWNLOAD_URL" >/dev/null; then
    echo "ERROR: Provided download URL is invalid." >&2
    exit 1
  fi

elif [ "${USE_PRERELEASE:-}" = "true" ]; then
  echo "Selecting latest prerelease..."
  # find all prereleases, pick the first (newest) and extract asset
  DOWNLOAD_URL="$(printf '%s\n' "$ALL_JSON" \
    | jq -c 'map(select(.prerelease==true)) | sort_by(.published_at) | reverse | .[0]' \
    | select_asset_url)"

elif [ -n "$VERSION" ] && [ "$VERSION" != "latest" ]; then
  echo "Looking for tag '$VERSION'..."
  MATCH="$(printf '%s\n' "$ALL_JSON" \
    | jq -c --arg v "$VERSION" '.[] | select(.tag_name==$v)')"
  if [ -n "$MATCH" ]; then
    DOWNLOAD_URL="$(printf '%s\n' "$MATCH" | select_asset_url)"
  else
    echo "Warning: tag '$VERSION' not found, falling back to latest stable."
    DOWNLOAD_URL="$(printf '%s\n' "$LATEST_JSON" | select_asset_url)"
  fi

else
  echo "Selecting latest stable release..."
  DOWNLOAD_URL="$(printf '%s\n' "$LATEST_JSON" | select_asset_url)"
fi

# 4) install
mkdir -p /mnt/server
cd /mnt/server

SERVER_BINARY=${SERVER_BINARY:-pico_limbo}
ARCHIVE=${DOWNLOAD_URL##*/}

echo "Downloading $ARCHIVE ..."
curl -sSL -o "$ARCHIVE" "$DOWNLOAD_URL"

echo "Extracting..."
tar -xzf "$ARCHIVE"
rm "$ARCHIVE"

chmod +x "$SERVER_BINARY"

echo "-----------------------------------------"
echo "Installed PicoLimbo -> /mnt/server/$SERVER_BINARY"
echo "-----------------------------------------"

variables.description: This secret is used to ensure that player info forwarded by Velocity comes from your proxy and not from someone pretending to run Velocity.

variables.name: Version
variables.description: The Git tag of the release you want to install. Can be a stable or prerelease tag (e.g. “v1.21.6”). If set to “latest” (or unset and no prerelease flag), the installer picks the newest stable release.

variables.name: Use Pre-release
variables.description: When set to “true”, the installer ignores stable releases and chooses the newest prerelease by publication date.
